title: Implement priority message queue for human steering
description:
Allow human orchestrator to inject messages to agents with priority levels:

1. STEERING (high priority) - Interrupts/redirects agent immediately
   - 'Stop what you're doing and focus on X'
   - 'Don't modify file Y'
   - Takes precedence over queued work

2. GUIDANCE (normal priority) - Queued for natural injection point
   - 'When you're done, also consider Z'
   - 'Use approach A instead of B'
   - Delivered when agent is idle/between tasks

Similar to Claude Code's message queue behavior. Needs:
- Priority enum (Steering, Guidance)
- Message queue per agent in SessionManager
- Injection logic (when to deliver based on agent state)
- CLI: rembrandt steer <agent> 'message' vs rembrandt tell <agent> 'message'

title: PTY refactor: remove background reader for direct attach
description:
## Problem
Current PTY architecture has a background reader thread that consumes all output to fill a RingBuffer. This prevents direct attach because:
1. Background thread consumes PTY output before attach can read it
2. No way to pause/stop the thread when attaching
3. Multiple readers on same PTY causes race conditions

## Solution
Refactor to on-demand reading:
1. Remove background reader thread from PtySession::spawn()
2. Add read_available() method that drains PTY buffer into RingBuffer
3. TUI calls read_available() each render cycle (~100ms)
4. Attach gets exclusive PTY access with direct stdin↔PTY↔stdout loop

## Files to modify
- src/daemon/session.rs - Remove reader thread, add read_available()
- src/daemon/buffer.rs - May need adjustments
- src/tui/attach.rs - Rewrite with exclusive PTY access
- src/tui/render.rs - Call read_available() in Solo view (if we add it back)

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Can spawn agent and see output in dashboard (read on demand)
- [ ] Can attach to agent with Ctrl+] to detach
- [ ] Full TUI apps (Claude Code, Opencode) render correctly when attached
- [ ] Keyboard input works in attached mode
